'''Chariots''' were used by [[Easterlings]]  of the [[Third Age]] for transportation and for war.<ref name=Northmen>{{UT|Northmen}}</ref>

==History==
During the invasion of the [[Wainriders]] the chieftains of the Wainriders fought in chariots.<ref>{{App|Gondor}}, entry for King Narmacil II, p. 1048</ref> 

In {{TA|1944}} in the battle known as the [[Disaster of the Morannon]] the vanguard of the Wainriders and their allies from [[Khand]], which consisted of war-chariots of the Wainriders and a force of cavalry, surprised the main force of [[Gondor]], which was led by [[King of Gondor|King]] [[Ondoher]]. The enemy vanguard crashed into the disordered line of the main force of Gondor, killed King Ondoher and his son [[Artamir]] with almost all of the king's Guard, and pushed the [[Gondorians|Gondorian]] [[Gondorian Military Forces|soldiers]] back, dispersing and pursuing many of them to the west into the [[Dead Marshes]].<ref name=Northmen/>

Later in the Third Age, on [[26 February]] {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, February 26, p. 1092</ref> [[Frodo Baggins]] had a vision of the chariots of chieftains coming from the [[Rhûn|East]] when he sat on the [[Seat of Seeing]] on [[Amon Hen]], the Hill of the Eye.<ref>{{FR|Breaking}}, pp. 400-1</ref> It is unknown whether these chariots were used in battle or for transportation.
